metadata.synopsis: This dialogue can take place in two different states. In the first, Apakusis is short and defensive. The grove's ranking leader, Kagha, has gathered support to close off the grove to outsiders with an intense ritual. She doesn't trust Kagha, and quietly despairs to see her grove turn to such measures.In the second state, the ritual has been stopped. She's shocked at the revelation that Kagha had been involved with Shadow Druids, and is having trouble accepting it.The player finds this druid speaking to a bird in the druid grove.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: What were you saying to that bird?

80.speaker: Apikusis
80.text: The bird knows. She needs to know. You do not.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'm not with these other tieflings - I'm a druid. You can speak freely.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Come now - surely a fellow druid is entitled to know.

35.speaker: Apikusis
35.text: I- forgive me. My love for my brethren is strong, but 'trust'? It is delicate.

61.speaker: Apikusis
61.text: More follow Kagha every day. They are afraid and she offers a simple solution - eject the refugees and we will be safe.

31.speaker: Apikusis
31.text: Perhaps not. But that does not make it right.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Sounds like she has to be stopped. How would we do that?

6.speaker: Apikusis
6.text: A druid and an outsider? We can do nothing without turning the others against us.

93.speaker: Apikusis
93.text: Only Master Halsin can stop this. I pray my bird returns with news of him.

22.speaker: Apikusis
22.text: If not, I fear for my people.

67.speaker: Apikusis
67.text: He left with the adventurers. They went treasure hunting in an old temple near here.

46.speaker: Apikusis
46.text: Master Halsin did not chase treasure. I do not know what he was chasing. But he never returned.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Are there any healers in this place?

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Shouldn't the ritual protect the grove? You're not helping the others prepare it.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I hear a ritual can protect the grove. Are you helping prepare it?

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You still haven't told me what you were doing with that bird.

14.speaker: Apikusis
14.text: It searches for news of Master Halsin. Only he can set this right.

83.speaker: Apikusis
83.text: If he is gone - well, pray that he is not.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'm not with the other tieflings, if that's what worries you.

55.speaker: Apikusis
55.text: I- forgive me. I don't fear your blood, tiefling. I fear my brethren.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Hmm... Suspicious. Do the other druids know? Because I could tell them.

56.speaker: Apikusis
56.text: We may talk, but - I do not trust my brethren.

86.speaker: Apikusis
86.text: Before you do that, see how our First Druid treats outsiders. Then decide if you would put your faith in her.

42.speaker: Apikusis
42.text: I'll tell you, but please don't do that again.

70.speaker: Apikusis
70.text: Your brutish demands have no place here.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I helped defend this grove - I'm not your enemy.

64.speaker: Apikusis
64.text: I - forgive me. It is not you I fear, it is my brethren.

25.speaker: Apikusis
25.text: Not all enemies are outside our walls.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?

28.speaker: Apikusis
28.text: Find Nettie in her room. Through the carved door, deeper in the grove.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: It doesn't look like you're helping with the ritual.

79.speaker: Apikusis
79.text: The ritual is Kagha's decision. But she is not our leader.

40.speaker: Apikusis
40.text: Master Halsin welcomed the refugees in. I wait for him to resolve this.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Is that why you were talking with that bird?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Halsin won't be resolving anything if he's dead.

72.speaker: Apikusis
72.text: Pray he is not. For the refugees' sake.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Are you helping to prepare for the ritual?

3.speaker: Apikusis
3.text: But if Master Halsin does not return, Kagha will give the order. And my voice will not matter.

69.speaker: Apikusis
69.text: I knew Kagha was desperate, but I never imagined she'd get Cloakwood involved.
69.context: NodeContext: She distrusted Kagha, but didn't think that she'd gone so far as to turn 'evil'

74.speaker: Apikusis
74.text: And it cost her her life. What a waste.
74.context: NodeContext: Players killed Kagha for her actions (or she turned good, but died in the combat)

78.speaker: Player
78.text: A waste? Don't you think she deserved it?

9.speaker: Apikusis
9.text: I could have forgiven her scheming. But the child...
9.context: NodeContext: Kagha either threatened to kill a child - or successffully did so.

92.speaker: Apikusis
92.context: NodeContext: She's glad that Kagha is dead - she killed a child.

63.speaker: Apikusis
63.text: She meant to kill that poor girl. There's no coming back from that.
63.context: NodeContext: She's still not sure if that meant Kagha should have died, but she's not torn up over it.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?

58.speaker: Apikusis
58.text: You pulled her from the brink. She owes you her life.
58.context: NodeContext: Players convinced Kagha to abandon the shadow druids.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You've known her longer - has she really changed?

94.speaker: Apikusis
94.text: By all appearances, yes - when I look at her, I see the Kagha I once knew.

7.speaker: Apikusis
7.text: But it could be another lie. I pray it isn't.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?

81.speaker: Apikusis
81.text: Shadow Druids... I still can't believe it.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?
